intro: Kibatalia elmeri, commonly known as the Elmer's kibatalia, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically eaten by local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
